alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 8:59PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pasquotank County in northeastern North Carolina... Camden County in northeastern North Carolina... Perquimans County in northeastern North Carolina... Currituck County in northeastern North Carolina... Southeastern Chowan County in northeastern North Carolina... The southeastern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The southeastern City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 1000 PM EST. * At 859 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Morgans Corner to Pungo Lake, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Elizabeth City, Elizabeth City State University, and Nixonton around 905 PM EST. Camden around 910 PM EST. Weeksville, Whitehall Shores, and Moyock around 915 PM EST. Currituck, Indiantown, and Shiloh around 920 PM EST. Virginia Beach and Old Trap around 925 PM EST. Knotts Island around 930 PM EST. Grandy and Corolla around 945 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Poplar Branch, Pierceville, Spot, Parkville, Jacocks, Spences Corner, Goose Creek, Harvey Point, Taylors Beach, and Belcross. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
